channel.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
channel.description: Is it good or bad to update Windows? I heard certain updates make your system processes use more out of your computer?? What should i do?

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: calhoun_freeman
item.description:
Well, I downloaded Korean, because I am… KOREAN!
You can unhide updates so no worries.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it good or bad to update Windows?

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: Asharil
item.description:
calhoun freeman:

I installed win 7, and bam, about 200 updates waiting for me. about 100 was language pack, so I hid those, and updated the others.

But… but… what if you want to use Windows in Bulgarian, Russian, Korean, Swahili, Croatian, Chinese (Mandarin) or Japanese?

WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO NOW?!

I installed all languages on my previous computer. Suddenly the whole start menu was packed with specific tools for the Korean language. So… annoying.

After installing Win 7 on my new rig, I made pretty damn sure non of the additional language files were installed. Yes I have the space, the computational power and what not to run whatever update… but that doesn’t mean I have to install it.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it good or bad to update Windows?

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: baz_uk
item.description:
Update essential ones only. It really does make things more secure. Do check what you wish to update, dont go for everything, other wise you can end up with crap you dont use and will slow down the computer.

I found updates for Win 98 and especially Win ME was awful and always messed with something else. But XP onwards seem fine, just be sensible.

As for graphics drivers, have mixed feelings about this. Yes updated drivers is good, but if everything works fine, just leave them as they are until maybe a new game or you find problems with a game such as low FPS/hitching anomaly etc

Always take a note of driver version before updating, that way if you do have problems, you know what you had before

Read full topic
item.source: Is it good or bad to update Windows?

item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I let Windows grab whatever updates it wants.

Right now I’m running W7 Enterprise at home. The only downside is every 6 months I need to “check in” with the computer either through VPN, or physically bringing the thing to work.

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: TheSuperNova
item.description:
ac3d:

Updates are like armor for your operating system, just don’t get the ones with WAT in them, a quick google will tell you which ones not to download… are we aloud to talk about this here?

Well, I’ll be staying well away from the kb971033 update then. Thanks for the heads up.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it good or bad to update Windows?

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Guys… service packs include updates released up to that point in time…

Definitely update your system. More often than not, updates bring security enhancements, performance improvements, better drivers, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it good or bad to update Windows?

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: Tei
item.description:
it used to be that Windows Update only patched patches with more patches. You could patch your patches with patched-up patches while you patched your patches. Each and every patch just laid over the top of each other, bogging down your system. Full-blown service packs were always the best route to go because they were streamlined CHANGES made to your operating system rather than patches that stackrf and trumped one-another.

i don’t know what to say now because i’m still using XP Pro with service-packs ONLY.

-Kawai Tei-

Read full topic
item.source: Is it good or bad to update Windows?

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: TheSuperNova
item.description:
Haven’t updated in a while. Same with my graphics drivers. If i have a problem and need to update then I will, but a couple of times now I’ve tried the latest stable release drivers (no, Not the beta releases) and have had problems with games and such, rolling back fixed it though.

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: FinlandGamer
item.description:
One Vista update made my CPU go haywire. While playing any game, it would just start lagging like hell. I opened task manager, and saw explorer.exe chew up all my resources.

Only way out of that was to reboot the system. It lasted about 4-5 month’s, untill a new update fixed it.

Now every time my laptop updates, i fear that it will cause my CPU go haywire again.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it good or bad to update Windows?

item.title: Is it good or bad to update Windows?
item.dc:creator: T-1000
item.description:
I never let any computers update themselves. I check the updates and install only the ones that are important, not the ones that Windows think are important. The less junk your computer have, the faster it is.

Read full topic

Good, it enhances functionality and security.

Occasionaly they do yes.

shifty:

What should i do?

Update your computer.
